    Introduction to oneway package

    oneway.Rmd

    Introduction

    Here is an article on using the oneway package.

    library(oneway)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'oneway'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:datasets':
#> 
#>     cars
fit <- oneway(mpg ~ carb, mtcars)
print(fit)
#> Summary Statistics
#>  ====================
#>   carb     mpg.n  mpg.mean    mpg.sd
#> 1    1  7.000000 25.342857  6.001349
#> 2    2 10.000000 22.400000  5.472152
#> 3    3  3.000000 16.300000  1.053565
#> 4    4 10.000000 15.790000  3.911081
#> 5    6  1.000000 19.700000        NA
#> 6    8  1.000000 15.000000        NA
#> Anova
#>  ===================
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = formula, data = data)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>    Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max 
#> -7.250 -3.316 -1.433  3.384 10.083 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  25.8723     1.8368  14.085 9.22e-15 ***
#> carb         -2.0557     0.5685  -3.616  0.00108 ** 
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 5.113 on 30 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.3035, Adjusted R-squared:  0.2803 
#> F-statistic: 13.07 on 1 and 30 DF,  p-value: 0.001084
plot(fit)
